name: twangy
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
making a noise like that of a tight string being quickly pulled and released: The song was accompanied by a twangy Western guitar.
used about a way of speaking that is typical of a particular person or area, often involving air passing out through the nose, which gives a particular quality to the voice : At that time, the factory workers in Atlanta were country people who'd come to town with twangy rural Georgia accents. Related word
twang
More examplesFewer examplesThere were twangy country songs playing in the background.The days when Indian music only conjured up twangy sitars have passed.He speaks in a soft, twangy drawl.Her distinctive twangy voice made a big impression on me.
